fusilli.fusion_models.base_modelÔÉÅ

Base lightning module for all fusion models and parent class for all fusion models.

Classes

BaseModel(model)

Base pytorch lightning model for all fusion models.

ParentFusionModel(pred_type,¬†data_dims,¬†params)

Parent class for all fusion models.
class BaseModel(model)[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: LightningModule

Base pytorch lightning model for all fusion models.

This class takes the specific fusion model as an input and provides the training and validation steps. The loss functions/metrics/activation function options are defined here and chosen based on the prediction type chosen by the user.

modelÔÉÅ

Fusion model class.

Type:

class

multiclass_dimÔÉÅ

Number of classes for multiclass prediction. Default is 3 for making the metrics dictionary.

Type:

int

train_maskÔÉÅ

Mask for training data, used for the graph fusion methods instead of train/val split. Indicates which nodes are training nodes.

Type:

tensor

val_maskÔÉÅ

Mask for validation data - used for the graph fusion methods instead of train/val split. Indicates which nodes are validation nodes.

Type:

tensor

loss_functionsÔÉÅ

Dictionary of loss functions, one for each prediction type.

Type:

dict

output_activation_functionsÔÉÅ

Dictionary of output activation functions, one for each prediction type.

Type:

dict

metricsÔÉÅ

Dictionary of metrics, two for each prediction type.

Type:

dict

batch_val_realsÔÉÅ

List of validation reals for each batch. Stored for later concatenation with rest of batches and access by Plotter class for plotting.

Type:

list

batch_val_predsÔÉÅ

List of validation preds for each batch. Stored for later concatenation with rest of batches and access by Plotter class for plotting.

Type:

list

batch_val_logitsÔÉÅ

List of validation logits for each batch. Stored for later concatenation with rest of batches and access by Plotter class for plotting.

Type:

list

batch_train_realsÔÉÅ

List of training reals for each batch. Stored for later concatenation with rest of batches and access by Plotter class for plotting.

Type:

list

batch_train_predsÔÉÅ

List of training preds for each batch. Stored for later concatenation with rest of batches and access by Plotter class for plotting.

Type:

list

val_realsÔÉÅ

Concatenated validation reals for all batches. Accessed by Plotter class for plotting.

Type:

tensor

val_predsÔÉÅ

Concatenated validation preds for all batches. Accessed by Plotter class for plotting.

Type:

tensor

val_logitsÔÉÅ

Concatenated validation logits for all batches. Accessed by Plotter class for plotting.

Type:

tensor

train_realsÔÉÅ

Concatenated training reals for all batches. Accessed by Plotter class for plotting.

Type:

tensor

train_predsÔÉÅ

Concatenated training preds for all batches. Accessed by Plotter class for plotting.

Type:

tensor

get_model_outputs(x)[source]ÔÉÅ

Get model outputs.

Parameters:

x (tensor) ‚Äì Input data.

Returns:

  • logits (tensor) ‚Äì Logits.

  • reconstructions (tensor) ‚Äì Reconstructions (returned if the model has a custom loss function such as a subspace method)

Note

if you get an error here, check that the forward output in fusion model is [out,] or [out, reconstructions]

get_model_outputs_and_loss(x, y, train=True)[source]ÔÉÅ

Parameters:

  • x (tensor) ‚Äì Input data.

  • y (tensor) ‚Äì Labels.

Returns:

  • loss (tensor) ‚Äì Loss.

  • end_output (tensor) ‚Äì Final output.

  • logits (tensor) ‚Äì Logits.

predict_step(batch: Any, batch_idx: int, dataloader_idx: int = 0) → Any[source]ÔÉÅ

Step function called during predict(). By default, it calls forward(). Override to add any processing logic.

The predict_step() is used to scale inference on multi-devices.

To prevent an OOM error, it is possible to use BasePredictionWriter callback to write the predictions to disk or database after each batch or on epoch end.

The BasePredictionWriter should be used while using a spawn based accelerator. This happens for Trainer(strategy="ddp_spawn") or training on 8 TPU cores with Trainer(accelerator="tpu", devices=8) as predictions won‚Äôt be returned.

Example

class MyModel(LightningModule):

    def predict_step(self, batch, batch_idx, dataloader_idx=0):
        return self(batch)

dm = ...
model = MyModel()
trainer = Trainer(accelerator="gpu", devices=2)
predictions = trainer.predict(model, dm)
Parameters:

  • batch ‚Äì Current batch.

  • batch_idx ‚Äì Index of current batch.

  • dataloader_idx ‚Äì Index of the current dataloader.

Returns:

Predicted output

validation_epoch_end(outputs)[source]ÔÉÅ

Gets the final validation epoch outputs and metrics. When metrics are calculated at the validation step and logged on on_epoch=True, the batch metrics are averaged. However, some metrics don‚Äôt average well (e.g. R2). Therefore, we‚Äôre calculating the final validation metrics here on the full validation set.

validation_step(batch, batch_idx)[source]ÔÉÅ

Validation step.

Parameters:

  • batch (tensor) ‚Äì Batch of data.

  • batch_idx (int) ‚Äì Batch index.

Return type:

None

class ParentFusionModel(pred_type, data_dims, params)[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

Parent class for all fusion models.

pred_typeÔÉÅ

Type of prediction to be made. Options: binary, multiclass, regression.

Type:

str

mod1_dimÔÉÅ

Dimension of modality 1.

Type:

int

mod2_dimÔÉÅ

Dimension of modality 2.

Type:

int

img_dimÔÉÅ

Dimensions of image modality. If using 2D images, then the dimensions will be (x, y). If using 3D images, then the dimensions will be (x, y, z).

Type:

tuple

paramsÔÉÅ

Dictionary of parameters.

Type:

dict

multiclass_dimÔÉÅ

Number of classes for multiclass prediction.

Type:

int

kfold_flagÔÉÅ

Whether to use k-fold cross validation.

Type:

bool

final_predictionÔÉÅ

Final prediction layers.

Type:

nn.Sequential

mod1_layersÔÉÅ

Modality 1 layers.

Type:

nn.ModuleDict

mod2_layersÔÉÅ

Modality 2 layers.

Type:

nn.ModuleDict

img_layersÔÉÅ

Image layers.

Type:

nn.ModuleDict

fused_layersÔÉÅ

Fused layers.

Type:

nn.Sequential

__init__(pred_type, data_dims, params)[source]ÔÉÅ
Parameters:

  • pred_type (str) ‚Äì Type of prediction to be made. Options: binary, multiclass, regression.

  • data_dims (list) ‚Äì List of data dimensions.

  • params (dict) ‚Äì Dictionary of parameters.

set_final_pred_layers(input_dim=64)[source]ÔÉÅ

Sets final prediction layers.

Parameters:

input_dim (int) ‚Äì Input dimension to final layers - may depend on fusion configuration.

Return type:

None

set_fused_layers(fused_dim)[source]ÔÉÅ

Set layers for fused modality

Parameters:

fused_dim (int) ‚Äì Dimension of fused modality: how many features are there after fusion? e.g. if we have 2 modalities with 64 features each, and the fusion method was concatenation, the fused_dim would be 128

Return type:

None

set_img_layers()[source]ÔÉÅ

Sets layers for image modality. If using 2D images, then the layers will use Conv2D layers. If using 3D images, then the layers will use Conv3D layers.

Parameters:

None ‚Äì

Return type:

None
